COVID‐19 is characterized by fever, weakness, dry cough, muscle soreness and dyspnoea. According to the study based on 1099 COVID‐19 hospitalized patients (926 non‐severe patients and 173 severe patients), fever was the most common symptom with 88.7% patients, followed by cough (67.8%), nausea or vomiting accounted for 5% of the total, 3.8% of the patients with diarrhoea and some patients with dizziness. Meanwhile, about 23.7% of the patients had hypertension or other underlying comorbidities.
